attributes.title: Genna
attributes.3: yes==In the books==In the ''A Song of Ice and Fire'' novels, there is no prostituteÂ named Genna. The only character by thatÂ name is Tywin Lannister's sister. This would seem to continue the TV producers' general practice that when they invent new characters for the TV series, they still try to use names from the books which are established to exist in Westeros (instead of making up entirely new ones, which might not sound like they fit).In the TV series, Tyrion pronounced "Genna" with a soft G, as opposed to a hard G.==References==ReflistCharacters significantly changed between books and TV seriesCategory:ProstitutesCategory:Status: AliveCategory:CharactersCategory:Season 3 CharactersCategory:Characters from the CrownlandsCategory:Minor Characters

sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, there is no prostituteÂ named Genna. The only character by thatÂ name is [[Tywin Lannister]]'s sister. This would seem to continue the TV producers' general practice that when they invent new characters for the TV series, they still try to use names from the books which are established to exist in Westeros (instead of making up entirely new ones, which might not sound like they fit).

In the TV series, Tyrion pronounced "Genna" with a soft G, as opposed to a hard G.

'''Genna '''is a character in the [[Season 3|third]] season. She is a [[Prostitution|prostitute]] in the [[King's Landing]] brothel owned by [[Petyr Baelish|Petyr "Littlefinger" Baelish]].
sections.Biography:
===[[Season 3]]===
Genna is one of the three prostitutes hired by [[Tyrion Lannister]] to service [[Podrick Payne]] as a reward for saving his life in the [[Battle of the Blackwater]].<ref>"[[Walk of Punishment]]"</ref>Genna and her colleagues are apparently so satisfied with Podrick that they decline payment, much to the astonishment of Tyrion, [[Bronn]], [[Ros]], and even [[Varys]].<ref>"[[And Now His Watch is Ended]]"</ref>
